intro: Hesperis borbasii, commonly known as the Balkan honesty, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Hesperis borbasii is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
